page.title: 07Small Shops in Purley
page.content: Around Purley there are many small parades of shops offering a valuable service to the old, handicapped and those without transport. The shops come in handy if anyone forgets something. A high majority think prices are too high for them so leave their shopping for the larger shops. The small shops are valuable for community life-meeting chatting and often having a drink together, but mainly for O.A.P's. Most parades contain a newsagents and often an off licence or general store. We agree that these shops are in a good position and most have adequate parking space. In our small survey 44% would shop locally more often if there were more bigger shops and 60% use take-away shops more than once a fortnight. Small shops are often run by people from India and Pakistan.
